intro: Begonia knoopii, commonly known as the Knobbed Begonia, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, thick, and often knobby stems that give it its common name. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom atop its upright foliage. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Begonia knoopii thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires indirect sunlight to flourish.
